item.title: Does Local State Capacity Foster Development in Africa? New Data and Analysis
item.description: I that increases in state reach measured through travel times to administrative capitals foster local development.

item.title: Local Ethno-Political Polarization and Election Violence in Majoritarian vs. Proportional Systems
item.description: Provides evidence that local ethno-political polarization increases violence before majoritarian but not PR elections in Africa.

item.title: Roads to Rule, Roads to Rebel: Relational State Capacity and Conflict in Africa
item.description: We find that roads decrease conflict risk in connecting ethnic groups to capitals, but increase it in connecting groups internally.

item.title: Linking Ethnic Data from Africa (LEDA)
item.description: We interlink 11 ethnic datasets from Africa via the language tree.

item.title: Continuity or Change? (In)direct Rule in British and French Colonial Africa
item.description: New historical data show that the British ruled more indirectly than the French, in particular in precolonially centralized regions.

item.title: Who Benefits? How Local Ethnic Demography Shapes Political Favoritism in Africa
item.description: We investigate how local ethnic demography affects strategies of favoritism in Africa.

item.title: New spatial data on ethnicity: Introducing SIDE
item.description: New data on the ethnic and religious composition of local populations in 47 low- and middle-income countries.
